text: Posting a comment on here just to say, I didn't plan it at all, I just got this song randomly in my head, today is the 10 year anniversary of when Supra posted this track. I remember when it was just posted. I can't even believe it's been 10 years already... Time flies, man. it truly does. This game's series and it's music will forever be something I treasure. Supra, my man, your channel will always be one I treasure. It was you that helped me find my love for video game music... I just... Am filled with so many emotions right now. Once again, happy 10th anniversary to this video! Here's to another 10!

text: +kingemac Gameplay was as generic as you could get honestly.
author: DOMIPS

text: +kingemac Gameplay was as generic as you could get honestly.
author: DOMIPS

text: @DOMIPS It was nothing special but the crafting mechanic was nice.
author: MassYak85

text: @DOMIPS TLOU gameplay may not have been revolutionary, but in some aspects it was quite innovative: the real-time carfting system as well as the listening mode were something I haven't seen like this before! that is more than you can say from U2! If any of these games were generic in gamplay, it was U2: all you would do is shoot, climb/jump and solve puzzels (Lara Croft sends her regards). The only thing that stoodout for me in U2 were its huge action set-pieces which were straightout of an action-adventure hollywood movie (Indiana Jones sends his regards too). Anyway, thats just IMHO.
author: kingemac

text: @kingemac The reason Naughty Dog games stand out is the story and characters
author: MassYak85

text: @TheBushwooky That is partly true, but IMO they're also outstanding graphically resp. technically, in art design as well as in their attention to details! and yes, the gameplay mostly serves the story, and not the otherway around!
author: kingemac

text: @kingemac agreed, graphics and visuals are always nice

text:
I love all the people that get into arguments with each other between consoles.
Here's something for ya to think over.
You know that game with the protagonist with the gruff voice and the daddy issues?
And he wields that weapon that literally shreds people apart?
And he fights giant monsters from the depths of the earth and some with tentacles?
You know, there's lots of blood and violence?
It's a trilogy?
Oh right! It's GOW!!!!!!
Fanboys=retards.

text: @Mastermindguy1994 I challenge that. The original Deus Ex is 10 years old, but it's gameplay elements surpass Uncharted 2. Not to mention it's non-linear in many ways and the plot kicks ass. If you try to tell me it sucks because using guns isn't as easy as Uncharted 2, that's because it's not a heavy shooter. It lets you shoot but it's trying to provoke sneaking and non-lethal attacks. It also allows to complete a mission in MANY ways. I replayed the game and found so many paths I missed.
